TopicTitle: [1.0.5] RSS Planets & Moons expanded v0.12.0 Sedna is finally here!

Articles.Content:
[@panourgue](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/159185-panourgue/) I think it will break things, better wait for an updated version.

Also for the previous version of RSS I was having issues with Remote Tech (I believe it has something to do with the celestial bodies index numbers) - the contracts are now referencing wrong bodies and antennae are not working

> 

![;.;](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cry.gif ";.;") Oh well.

Wait, have you actually tried that? Cause I'm not sure it will. I'd try it myself only it's almost painful to wait for this mod to generate Kopernicus's cache (not exactly how this works but you know what I mean)

I haven't tried it but I just have that feeling that it will break things.

I was having issues with Remote Tech as well so actually I was thinking of uninstalling this mod until a new update is pushed

[@panourgue](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/159185-panourgue/) RSS \_requires\_ Kopernicus. ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif ";)") Has since KSP 1.0 came out, RSS is just configs + textures for the Kopernicus plugin. Plus a tiny bit of plugin itself. The change is that those configs are no longer in one massive file.
You should add 101955 Bennu, in honour of the recently-joined chief astrochemist for the OSIRIS REx mission.

Wow, thank you for this mod. This is exactly what I was looking for. There's so much more to our solar system than just the eight planets, this mod really helps to bring to life the complexity and great number of bodies floating around our sun. Thanks!

[@pozine](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/134382-pozine/) hi ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

I was messing around with this mod to fix compatibility with GN and found a couple of bugs:

1- [LOG 02:34:24]: [Kopernicus]: Configuration.Loader: Failed to load Body: Dactyl

the biome map of dactyl has the wrong name, so the body doesn't load

2- (admittedly this isn't a bug since this mod has to be used with RSS 10.4.1)

with the latest RSS there are 2 charons so none load.

I guess you are probably already aware of those, but I thought to mention them just in case ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")
Is it possible to use this with the small solar system addon?

> 
> 
> On 04/04/2016 at 6:25 PM, SyzarDenz said:
> 
> 
> Is it possible to use this with the small solar system addon?
> 

I'd love to know this too! Anyone?

Yay Makemake has a moon!

<iframe allowfullscreen="true" frameborder="0" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/er1sBpyih0s?feature=oembed" width="480"></iframe>

 Will you add it once we know a bit more about it?
when will this be updated to kopernicus 1.0?

Answering a question that [@curiousepic](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/60039-curiousepic/) asked to the <abbr title="Real Solar System (mod)">RSS</abbr> thread:

> 
> 
> On 5/5/2016 at 1:27 AM, curiousepic said:
> 
> 
> What kind of work? Mind posting in that thread?
> 

Since [Kopernicus Expansion](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/119211-wip-kopernicus-expansion-v02-comets-footprints-new-pqsmods-for-kopernicus/&page=1) has not been updated (at the time of this post) for Kopernicus 1.0.3 and KSP 1.1.2 you need to disable the "Comet" mods from any body that uses it:

    Ceres
    67P
    Halley

- Remove any references to the Pluto system from the "000-RSSPatches.cfg" file (lines 201 to 589).
- Correct the biome texture name of Dactyl from "MetisBiomes" to "Metisbiome".

I might have missed something so ping me back for any questions or problems.

**Edited <time datetime="2016-11-17T11:14:41Z" title="11/17/2016 11:14  AM" data-short="7 yr">November 17, 2016</time> by Phineas Freak**
  
Typos

I am willing to maintain the mod from now on (i.e. port it over to 1.1.2 and then add more stuff). If it is OK with [@pozine](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/134382-pozine/), then I will make a thread on Space Dock. I have also already started working on the descriptions that are missing for the various celestial bodies that this mod adds. I just want your nod of approval.

Pozine hasn't been on since February, so I think someone should take over this mod.

It seems like he left.

It's your choice, think what's best. And also remember to check the license first.
The license permits it.  My suggestion is to create your own thread for release/maintenance, rename it slightly ("redux", "maintained", etc...), and hand it back if/when pozine comes back.

> The license permits it.  My suggestion is to create your own thread for release/maintenance, rename it slightly ("redux", "maintained", etc...), and hand it back if/when pozine comes back.
> 

Why should I? If I recoded it, then I would, but all the textures and the code is by pozine. I'm just going to maintain and update it, I have just been calling it 'Real Solar System Expanded'.

> 
> 
> Just now, ImkSushi said:
> 
> 
> Why should I? If I recoded it, then I would, but all the textures and the code is by pozine. I'm just going to maintain and update it, I have just been calling it 'Real Solar System Expanded'.
> 

Renaming it and moving to your own thread:

1. Allows you to control the OP for updates and such

2. Implies that this is a continuation of the work done by pozine and not the actual work maintained by pozine

3. Avoids stepping on pozine's toes should they decide to return.

The license says that you must credit pozine regardless.
